thread.title: Woman, 18, falsely accused two football players of rape: cops
thread.title_full: Woman, 18, falsely accused two football players of rape: cops

author: DAVID BOROFF
title: Woman, 18, falsely accused two football players of rape: cops
text:
Nikki Yovino was charged with falsely reporting an incident and tampering with or fabricating physical evidence. (Bridgeport Police Dept) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Wednesday,  44 PM 
An 18-year-old woman from New York was hit with charges after authorities say she falsely accused two Connecticut football players of rape. 
The two players were kicked out of Sacred Heart University according to the Connecticut Post , but a school spokesperson told the Daily News on Wednesday that the students were not expelled. 
Nikki Yovino had claimed she was pulled into a bathroom by two men during a football party in Bridgeport. However, a student overheard Yovino telling the two of them that she wanted to have sex with them, according to an arrest warrant affidavit obtained by the newspaper. 
When pressed by cops, she said she lied because of her potential interest in another man, according to authorities. 
Conn. couple fined for racial slur vandalism left on their home 
"She admitted that she made up the allegation of sexual assault against (the football players) because it was the first thing that came to mind and she didnâ€™t want to lose (another male student) as a friend and potential boyfriend," read the affidavit obtained by the newspaper. "She stated that she believed when (the other male student) heard the allegation it would make him angry and sympathetic to her." 
Yovino, who is from South Setauket, N.Y., was charged with falsely reporting an incident and tampering with or fabricating physical evidence, according to the Connecticut Post . 
Her Stamford-based lawyer Mark Sherman told the Daily News in a statement that he expects Yovino to plead not guilty at her arraignment on March 3. He said he has not been provided the police reports and video footage. 
"The details of what happened here will come out at the appropriate time during the court process," he said in the statement. Join the Conversation:
